div.div: Â Abby Kelley to continue with Distance Learning for the remainder of the school year MORE

div.h6: Abby Kelley to continue with Distance Learning for the remainder of the school year

div.div: Tuesday, April 21, 2020 Governor Baker announced that schools within Massachusetts would remain closed for the rest of the spring. Abby Kelley will continue to follow the District's Distance Learning Plan.

div.p: On Tuesday, April 21, 2020 Governor Baker announced that schools in Massachusetts will remain closed for the remainder of this school year. Abby Kelley will continue with our established Distance Learning Plan.
div.h4: What can we do toÂ safeguard the Abby Kelley community?

p.br:
- Frequent and thorough hand washing with soap and water for at least 20 seconds is recommended. Hand sanitizer is an option if soap and water are not available. It is highly encouraged that one not touch their eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.
- âHigh Touchâ surfaces (railings, doors, sinks) Â should be cleaned daily. This has always been and will continue to be the practice of our Facilities staff. These practices are encouraged to continue in your homes as well.
-Everyone is reminded of the importance of good coughing and sneezing etiquette; coughing and sneezing in oneâs elbow, using and disposing of a tissue, washing your hands if you cough or sneeze (on them).
- Abby Kelley students and staff are asked to stay home if you are sick, please. Anyone who presents with a fever MUST remain out of school and should be fever free for 24 hours without medication before returning to school.
Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â

hr.p: Charter schools may not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, creed, sex, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, homelessness, age, ancestry, athletic performance, special need, proficiency in the English language or in a foreign language, or academic achievement in admitting students, nor may charter schools set admissions criteria that are intended to discriminate or that have the effect of discriminating on any of these bases.Â M.G.L. c. 71, Â§ 89(l);Â 603 CMR 1.06(1).

AKFCS is committed to providing an accessible website to all people to the maximum
extent possible. If you encounter a problem with accessing any information on this website,
